title: The Earnings Picture Continues to Improve
text: Given the emerging consensus on the 'soft-landing' outlook, one can expect this favorable turn in the overall earnings picture to strengthen further as companies report Q3 results and share trends in underlying business.

title: META Up +4% on +23% Revenue Growth; IBM and NOW Also Beat
text: The social media leader posted a big beat on earnings -- $4.39 per share versus expectations of $3.62 and the year-ago number of $1.64 per share.

title: 3 Fabulous AI Stocks to Triple Your Returns
text: Artificial intelligence ( AI ) is changing everything. The debut of the generative AI chatbot ChatGPT last November set in motion a dramatic realignment in what was achievable.

title: Microsoft Shares Jump as Cloud Revenue Boosts Earnings
text: Microsoft (MSFT) shares were nearly 3% higher in mid-afternoon trading Wednesday, bucking a broader market downturn, after the company late Tuesday reported better-than-expected fiscal first-quarter earnings, fueled by a turnaround in its Azure cloud segment.

title: Google's Cloud Disappointed, Microsoft's Impressed. What's In Store For Amazon?
text: Microsoft stock gained on a cloud revenue boost, Google's fell after a cloud miss. What are the expectations for AMZN stock?

title: Microsoft (MSFT) Q1 Earnings & Revenues Beat on Cloud Strength
text: Microsoft's (MSFT) first-quarter fiscal 2024 results reflect strength in the Azure business and Office 365, powered by the growing AI business.

title: Microsoft Azure revenue, AI adoption impress analysts after 3Q results
text: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) shares rose Wednesday on strong third-quarter results driven by its cloud division and AI services, and analysts largely liked what they say.  Bank of America raised its price target to $415 from $405 while UBS and Jefferies maintained $400 targets, with all repeating a Buy rating.

title: 3 Boring Stocks to Buy and Hold for Your Whole Lifetime
text: Call me boring but I love to pick stocks that have a strong history and solid balance sheet that keep rewarding investors. Who doesn't enjoy passive income?

title: Why Microsoft Stock Was in Rally Mode on Wednesday
text: Microsoft delivered a strong performance, highlighted by accelerating cloud results. The company's early foray into AI is paying off, but it's just getting started.

title: ETFs to Buy on Solid AI-Fueled Microsoft Q1 Earnings
text: Microsoft posts strongest sales growth in six quarters, driven by higher demand for its cloud computing services.

title: $240 billion gap widens between Microsoft and Google
text: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT)'s leading position in the artificial intelligence arms race and Google parent Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOG)'s flailing position in the cloud computer space were central talking points in the latest tech earnings season. Microsoft, the world's second-largest megacap, impressed the market, with revenue up 13% year-over-year to $56.5 billion, driven by its cloud division and its adoption of AI services powered by partner OpenAI.

title: Alphabet stock falls 8% on cloud miss as investors praise Microsoft Azure growth
text: Google's Cloud revenue miss came in stark contrast to Microsoft's earnings, which showed accelerated growth in its Intelligent Cloud business

title: Microsoft Leading Alphabet In Race To Monetize Generative AI
text: Analysts polled by Refinitiv had expected $60.9 billion in revenue.

title: Alphabet Stock Set For Worst Day In 12 Months As Microsoft Again Asserts AI Lead
text: The Google selloff is “overdone” as focusing on the earnings report's sole blemish in cloud profits is a mistake, according to some analysts.

title: US stocks trade mixed after mega-cap tech earnings from Microsoft and Alphabet
text: US stocks were mixed on Wednesday as investors digested earnings from Microsoft and Alphabet. Microsoft posted strong cloud growth and saw its stock pop, while Alphabet fell after it reported lower-than-expected cloud revenue.

title: Dow opens higher, lifted by Microsoft's post-earnings rally
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average opened higher on Wednesday as a post-earnings rally in shares of Microsoft Corp. MSFT, +3.89% helped lift the blue-chip gauge while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite sunk. The Dow gained 91 points, or 0.3%, at to trade at 33,218, according to FactSet data.

title: AI and Big Tech: How are Apple, Microsoft and Nvidia planting their flags?
text: What is artificial intelligence? If you ask IBM, “at its simplest form, artificial intelligence is a field, which combines computer science and robust datasets, to enable problem-solving” while also encompassing “sub-fields of machine learning and deep learning, which are frequently mentioned in conjunction with artificial intelligence”.

title: Microsoft shares rise as Wall Street heralds 'strong execution,' wider AI rollout
text: Analysts praised Microsoft's results and expressed optimism about the company's product pipeline, including Microsoft 365 Copilot.

title: High-Value Microsoft still has Plenty of Room to Run
text: Microsoft may be highly valued NASDAQ: MSFT, but the company and stock price still have plenty of room to run. Valuation, the P/E multiple, and market cap are fickle things and driven by desire, and Microsoft is a desirable stock.

title: These 2 Stocks Are Giving the Dow Jones Industrials a Lift
text: The Dow looked poised to rise on Wednesday morning, defying declines in other indexes. Microsoft reported strong growth in its cloud computing business, supported by AI innovation.

title: Google And Microsoft Earnings Impress With Meta Scheduled To Report Tonight
text: We'll see if last night's earnings are enough to keep the market moving forward, or if there was reason for concern.

title: Microsoft ‘has taken the AI mantel from Google'—and now it's coming for Amazon in the cloud
text: Against a choppy economic backdrop for the broader software industry, Microsoft Corp. is still thriving.

title: Microsoft jumps while Google owner Alphabet slips as Wall Street zeroes in on the tech giants' AI efforts
text: Microsoft shares climbed 4% in premarket trading after a strong quarterly earnings report. Alphabet slipped 7% as revenue for its cloud division fell short of Wall Street's expectations.

title: Microsoft's stock is rising enough to turn Dow futures positive
text: The surge in Microsoft Corp.'s stock MSFT, +0.37%, in the wake of the software behemoth's blowout earnings report, was the reason futures YM00, +0.11% for the Dow Jones Industrial Average ES00, -0.35% were gaining ground while the broader market was falling. The stock jumped 3.7% toward a three-month high in premarket trading.

title: Microsoft surpasses Alphabet in cloud race with OpenAI bet, enterprise focus
text: Microsoft is outstripping Alphabet in the race to make money from generative artificial intelligence through early bets on OpenAI and focus on big clients, raising worries that the Google parent could lose share in the cloud-computing market.

title: Tech Titans Upcoming Earnings: Shaping the Markets Fate
text: This week marks a pivotal moment in the financial world as some of the globe's most influential companies unveil their quarterly earnings reports, particularly in the technology sector.

title: Microsoft Gets Another Leg Up on Google in AI Race
text: Google's cloud business is slowing and weighing on earnings, while Microsoft's Azure is shaking off a slump.

title: Xbox boosted by Starfield launch as console sales dwindle
text: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) saw revenues from Xbox content and services rise 12% in the first quarter of 2024, a trading update revealed. Jumping more than all other categories, apart from its software offerings which include cloud services and Office 365, Microsoft confirmed much of this growth was propped up by an 8% jump in gaming revenues.

title: Microsoft shares surge on bumper growth in cloud-computing unit as Alphabet stock drops on weak Google cloud results
text: Microsoft Corp. shares MSFT, +0.37% rallied 4% after the company posted better-than-expected growth in the company's Azure cloud-computing unit.

title: Microsoft Took Market Share from Google. How AI Is Changing Cloud Competition.
text: Microsoft's Azure impressed where Google Cloud disappointed and the reason behind the divergence looks to be in artificial intelligence.

title: S&P 500 futures slip as Google parent's slump offsets Microsoft advance
text: U.S. stock futures were mixed early Wednesday as a sharp decline in Alphabet shares counteracted a jump in Microsoft following earnings.

title: Microsoft reports higher profits and revenue powered by cloud computing and AI investments
text: Microsoft on Tuesday reported a 27% increase in profit for the July-September quarter compared to the same time last year, powered by growth in its cloud computing division where it has centered its investments in artificial intelligence.
